title.narrative: Diakonia Somalia: Democracy, Human Rights and Resilience 2020-2023
Diakonia Somalia: Demokrati, mänskliga rättigheter och resiliens 2020-2023

description.narrative:
Diakonia har inkommit med en ansökan om stöd till Sida för programmet Democracy, Human Rights and Resilience (DHRR) i Somalia för perioden 2020-2023. Det övergripande syftet med DHRR är att bidra till demokratiskt statsbyggande och motståndskraft mot katastrofer i Somalia med särskilt mål att förbättra demokratiskt deltagande och samhällsstyrning; stärka respekten för mänskliga rättigheter; och förbättra hanteringen av katastrofrisker i Puntland och South West State. De förväntade resultaten är: 1) stärkt inkluderande deltagande och ansvarsutkrävande i 15 distrikt; 2) ökad kunskap om och respekt för mänskliga rättigheter i 15 distrikt; 3) förbättrad katastrofriskhantering i 15 distrikt; och 4) partners har stärkt kapacitet att bidra till demokratiskt statsbyggande och motståndskraft mot katastrofer.
Programmet genomförs i samarbete med lokala partnerorganisationer och nätverk från det civila samhället och offentliga institutioner.
Insatsens totala budget är 73 000 000 SEK och Sida föreslås som enda givare. Drygt 40 000 000 SEK av den totala budgeten kommer att vidareförmedlas till Diakonias partnerorganisationer.

Diakonia has submitted a proposal to Sida for support to the programme Democracy, Human Rights and Resilience (DHRR) in Somalia for the period 2020-2023. The overall goal of the DHRR is to contribute to democratic state building and disaster resilience in Somalia, with the specific objective to improve democratic participation and governance; improve respect for human rights; and enhance disaster risk management in Puntland and South West State. The expected results are: 1) improved inclusive participation and accountability in 15 districts; 2) increased awareness and respect for human rights in 15 districts; 3) enhanced disaster risk management in 15 districts; and 4) partners have strengthened capacity to contribute to democratic state building and disaster resilience.
The programme will be implemented in collaboration with local partner organisations and networks from civil society and public institutions.
The total budget is SEK 73,000,000 and Sida is proposed as the only donor. Approximately SEK 40,000,000 of the total budget will be forwarded to Diakonia's partner organisations.

description.narrative:
Diakonia reports that despite movement restrictions and the countrywide lockdown in 2020, the programme has been implemented according to plan. Hyper inflation of the Somali shilling has, however, indirectly affected the programme intervention as it has reduced morale and interest for democratic interventions.
An important result reported by Diakonia is that partners have established civil registration units in all targeted districts. This is a critical step and fulfills the basic conditions for local governance and democratic participation. The most recent achieved results are related to the early elections in Puntland. Diakonia and partners conducted civic education activities and arranged for a so-called election situation room. The turnout of the elections was higher than expected and the whole process was managed without any mayor difficulties.
During the field visits in 2021, it has also become evident that Diakonia's approach to supporting partners is conducive for strengthening the institutional capacity of partners. An important result of this is the fact that some partners are now eligible for applying for direct funding from other donors.
